strings:
<se_low>Yangus: This place is a bit odd, eh?
Wiv all its round buildin's, like.

<se_low>Yangus: Ev'rywhere looks the same to me. I dunno 'ow they expect a bloke to find 'is way 'round.
I ain't got a clue where I am 'alf the time!
<se_high>Jessica: Let's put our dog-catching problem aside for the moment and do what we promised Marta first.

<se_high>Jessica: We're supposed to take that bag she gave us to a herb doctor named Marek, right?
Let's look for him!

<se_def>Angelo: It's just as I feared.
All the women here wear far too many layers.
<se_def>Angelo: Still, I suppose taking them off one by one has its charms, too.

<se_low>Yangus: Huh, huh...
You saucy ol' devil!
<se_low>Yangus: I thought it'd be easy enough to find one measly doctor, but we ain't 'avin' much luck, eh?

<se_low>Yangus: This is turnin' into a right pain.
Why don't we just chuck away that bag the old lady give us an' 'ave done wiv it!?

<se_high>Jessica: How could you say that, Yangus!?
Marta saved our lives, remember!?
We can't just break our promise to her!

<se_low>Yangus: Awright, awright!
I was only jokin', anyway.
I'm never one to shirk a duty, y'know.

<se_high>Jessica: I wonder sometimes.
Anyway, we're going to find Marek!
Understood?
<se_low>Yangus: Yes, sir!

<se_high>Jessica: Marek doesn't seem to be in Orkutsk.
So where did he go?

<se_def>Angelo: So we've come unstuck on both counts.
No Marek, and no Leopold either...
<se_def>Angelo: Maybe they've been swallowed up by the snow, never to be seen again.
<se_low>Yangus: It's nice to be able to take a breather at last, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: It was a bit too lively back there for a while, wot wiv icy-colds fallin' down all over the shop an' wolves tryin' to eat us!
<se_high>Jessica: I wonder what Marta was thinking when she gave us the nook grass for Marek.
<se_high>Jessica: They're rare herbs, you know? They aren't easy to grow. So she must have put a lot of love into making that bag for him.
<se_def>Angelo: There's a thing or two we'd like to ask Marek, right? So if he wants us to go and chat with him, great. Suits me.

<se_def>Marek: There is something I must talk to you about.
Please, come to my room and we will discuss it there.
<se_low>Yangus: That Marek bloke's pretty cool, eh?

<se_low>Yangus: Now that's wot I call a proper doctor, always puttin' 'is patients first.
Even when they're no-good drunks!
<se_high>Jessica: Marek decided to abandon his family duties to pursue his own dream.
<se_high>Jessica: And Marta not only respects his decision, but supports it!

<se_high>Jessica: It's a really beautiful thing.
I have to admit I'm a bit jealous.
<se_high>Jessica: I wish Mother were a little more understanding about my dreams, but she's so stubborn!
<se_def>Angelo: I can't believe it. We were sitting there, drinking tea with the sage's heir and we never even knew...
<se_def>Angelo: That's just typical of our luck! Always behind Dhoulmagus, always turning up too late to do anything but mop up after his latest atrocity!
<se_low>Yangus: This place always does me 'ead in, wot wiv ev'rywhere lookin' the same.
<se_low>Yangus: I s'pose ya can find wot yer lookin' for if ya go 'round enough times, though...
<se_high>Jessica: I suppose they connected all the buildings together like this so they wouldn't get snowed in.
<se_high>Jessica: So long as they have those enclosed passageways, they can move around freely even in a blizzard.

<se_high>Jessica: It makes a lot of sense.
Just the kind of architecture you'd expect up here in snow country!
<se_def>Angelo: Huh!
<se_def>Angelo: They have no idea that one of the bloodlines of the great sages ended here!<page>Angelo: And they're blissfully unaware of the threat of the Lord of Darkness!

<se_def>Angelo: I know it can't be helped, but they're all just so clueless and laidback.
It's more than a little irritating.
<se_low>Yangus: You plannin' on goin' all 'round the world to see 'ow people are copin' wiv Rhapthorne bein' back on the scene, guv?

<se_low>Yangus: Wot a nice bloke you are!
I'd never be bothered to go to all that effort, meself!
<se_high>Jessica: Even though they live in a remote corner of the world, the people here seem to know that strange things are afoot.

<se_high>Jessica: Everyone looks so nervous and worried.
Don't you think?

<se_def>Angelo: I wonder what would happen if all these laidback types here knew about Rhapthorne?
Knew about the danger the world's in?

<se_def>Angelo: Heh heh heh.
I'm almost curious enough to see their reaction that it might just slip out!

<se_high>Jessica: Why don't you go ahead and tell them, Angelo?
After all, nobody's going to believe a slimy cheat like you!
<se_def>Angelo: I doubt that, my lovely Jessica.
<se_def>Angelo: And, if we're going to fight Rhapthorne, maybe it would be better to spread a bit of fear around.
<se_def>Angelo: That way, we'll be heroes the world over when we win! I'm sure it would be a great pull for the ladies.

<se_high>Jessica: What's wrong with you!?
You can't go around saying things like that!

<se_def>Angelo: Why not!?
Some of them need a bit of a nudge in the right direction.
<se_high>Jessica: That's not what I meant!

<se_high>Jessica: Aren't you supposed to be a Templar?
I would have thought impersonating the Goddess is against the rules!

<se_def>Angelo: No problem there either!
The Goddess I believe in doesn't care about nonsense like that!
<se_high>Jessica: Well, don't come crying to me if the Goddess drops a mountain on you or something!
<se_low>Yangus: I've never been able to find me way 'round this place. It's like a bloomin' maze! I don't fancy our chances of findin' an orb 'ere!
<se_low>Yangus: Toot-oot-ot! ♪ That's gotta be the way forward 'ere. Let the flute do the 'ard work for us.
<se_high>Jessica: Rumours travel fast, don't they? Even out here in the middle of snow country, they know about the strange things happening across the world.
<se_high>Jessica: You can sense the tension in the air. Everyone's on edge.
<se_def>Angelo: According to Empyrea, we couldn't so much as hurt Rhapthorne's feelings as things stand.
<se_def>Angelo: We should take help wherever we can get it. The seven orbs, the spirits of seven sages, whatever.

<se_low>Morrie: This Orkutsk town is made like the doughnut.
All the places are joined together in a ring.
...I like it! No chances to get lost, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: Allora! We get croaking on the job the signora Marta is asking us to do, si?
<se_low>Morrie: If you ask me, it is non possibile to get lost in this place. I think the signor must be somewhere outside the town, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: Something we no can talk about in the open airs, ay? Something for our ears only.
<se_low>Morrie: Maybe he has the informazione about a powerful monster for my pit!
<se_low>Morrie: Signora Marta is the discendente of the great sages? Then maybe the place she was protecting is something importante to the sages, ay?
<se_high>Red: It's too cold to mess around outside in this freezin' 'ole, so they do their shoppin' indoors, eh? Well, they've got their 'eads screwed on round 'ere, I'll give 'em that.

<se_high>Red: But don't that mean they ain't got a clue
wot's goin' on around 'em in the world?
Now that ain't smart.
<se_low>Morrie: Outside, it is freezing cold, but inside, the place is so warm, ay? The differenza is making me sleepy. Aaahhh...
<se_low>Morrie: M-Mamma mia! I was nearly having my way with the fairies just then! I must wake myself up!
<se_high>Red: Even in a place as stuck out on a limb as this, they've noticed things ain't right wiv the world, eh?
<se_high>Red: But they 'aven't got the foggiest wot's really goin' on. They're just thinkin' the worst and gettin' more and more scared. Wot a terrible way to be, eh?
<se_low>Morrie: Ah ha ha ha, the ice skating in the piazza was <endash> How do you say? <endash> top of the notches, ay? ...Che? It was only me?

<se_low>Morrie: No no no! You forget. We are all going
around and around in the circles, si?
...Che? It was only me?
